taxon_identification.taxon_hierarchy: family rosaceae;tribe rubeae;genus rubus;subgenus eubatus;section flagellares;species scambens;

treatment.description: Low-arching and trailing; canes firm, soon becoming reddish-brown or purplish, 2-3.5 mm. thick at base, with scattered broad-based hooked prickles mostly 1.5-4 mm. long; floricane-leaves 3-foliolate, with the lower leaflets subsessile, often plush-like beneath; leaflets caudate-acuminate, sharply double-serrate, the terminal one ovate and one-half to three-fourths as broad as long, the laterals nearly as large but oblique; flowering shoots more or less stipitate-glandular, their petioles commonly so; 3-foliolate leaves of flowering shoots with elliptic-oval terminal leaflet at least half as broad as long, the simple bracteal leaves broader; flower usually single, on villous and often glandular pedicel.
treatment.habitat_elevation_distribution_or_ecolog: Open woods, thickets and clearings, se. Mass to se. Va. Fl. late April-June; fr. May-Aug.
